timeline.bodyText: Why do we throw IOException and an explicit FileNotFoundException if we only catch the IOException in initRepoRegistry()?
timeline.author: JAmmermann-DLR

replies.bodyText: Well spotted. Removed the Exception as suggested.
replies.author: PhilMFischer

timeline.author: JAmmermann-DLR

replies.bodyText: Fixed, a remote SVN repo had to be created first, otherwise the instantiation of an SVN Repo and Server will fail.
replies.author: PhilMFischer

timeline.author: JAmmermann-DLR

timeline.message:
Changes due to review - (Task #537)

- removed redundant exception in throw statement of method

---
Task #537: Persistency for server project repositories

Minor fixes due to review - (Task #537)

- Had to add a remote repo to also test ramping up a SVN backend in the
repo registry tests.

---
Task #537: Persistency for server project repositories

Fixed dependency to CreateSvnServerOperation - (Task #537)

- Tycho cannot resolve fragments as Eclispe IDE does, therefore classes
which are reused in another test fragment need to be placed in a package
which does not exist in the host and this package needs to be implicitly
imported to the using fragment.

---
Task #537: Persistency for server project repositories

Fix location of test resource - (Task #537)

Moving test reosurce from plugin path to runtime workspace

---
Task #537: Persistency for server project repositories
